Description: Fragment of oval handle at neck join of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine red-brown. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 148 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Pythogenes. Probably from the same die is Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, CEALEX GAB 0916.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (231)
